description:
When I tell people about grants they could get to help fund work on open
source software projects, sometimes they are surprised because they
didn't know such grants existed. I share:

-  sample foundations and funders (such as
   `Mozilla <https://www.mozilla.org/moss>`__, the `Chan Zuckerberg
   Initiative <https://chanzuckerberg.com/eoss/>`__,
   `NLNet <https://nlnet.nl/>`__, and
   `Comcast <https://innovationfund.comcast.com/>`__) who want to fund
   open source software projects, and how much they're paying out
-  a quick case study on how the Python Software Foundation got funding
   from Open Tech Fund to `improve security, accessibility, and
   localization for
   PyPI <https://wiki.python.org/psf/PackagingWG#Warehouse:_OTF_grant>`__
-  key steps in figuring out a good project idea, budgeting, hiring, and
   submitting
-  how the new `Project Funding Working
   Group <https://wiki.python.org/psf/ProjectFundingWG>`__ at the PSF
   can help you along the way
title: Apply for Grants To Fund Open Source Work
